item.title: Calculate the variance of a sample from the variances of its subsamples
item.description: Calculating the mean of a sample from the means of its subsamples is pretty straightforward1. Calculating however the variance of a sample from the variances of its subsamples didn't seem straightforward to me. It looks like there is a formula that allows us to do that. Assuming we have \(g\) sub-samples, each with \(k_j\), \(j=1,...,g\) elements for a total of \(n=\sum k_j\) values, then: \[ Var(X_1,...,X_n) = \frac{1}{n-1}(\sum_{j=1}^{g} (k_j-1)Var_j + \sum_{j=1}^{g}k_j(\bar{X}_j-\bar{X})^2) \]
